subject: Re: [junit] What is the solution to test web services?

messageBody:
On Friday 07 January 2005 18:00, Jirong Hu wrote:

> How do you test web services, both for unit test and integration
> test?

There are quite a few different things you can test.

A web service is one technical means of exposing some business
functionality. The business functionality should be completely
independent of any web services concerns. Thus the first thing is to
test this functionality on its own.

What remains of the web service is a wrapper around some business
interface. For testing purposes, this interface should be implemented
by a stub or mock object. Then, depending on the WS toolkit you're
using, there are several ways to decompose the testing task.

For instance, with Apache Axis, you can test custom de/serializers
separately [1] and test calls to the web service in-process [2]. I
don't know how to get at the SOAP response in-process, but I'm sure
it's possible somehow.

Then, of course, you can access the web service with a tool such as
httpUnit, where on the server side your mock business functionality
checks that it gets the expected request and on the client side the
response is compared with what's expected.

HTH,
Michael
